Description: Provides the capability for scheduling events like meetings, appointments, or similar activities for your application's end users.  ADSP gives you full backend support for creating persistent events, managing attendees, event queries, and automatic time-zone conversion.  It can be used to populate any front-end calendar widget with daily, weekly, or monthly entries.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: Use the configuration service to optimally store, and cache, static data used to drive your application.  The service ensures persistent, and schema-compliant, configuration storage using a JSON document store. Write operations will be validated against the schema for accurate and consistent data.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: As a central register of APIs, the Directory Service gives you a means for service discovery.  They can use the Directory Service to find service URLs and decouple application code from changes in the URL due to, for example, a newer version, or a change in the application's environment.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: The event service provides the capability for applications to define, and log, domain events.  This gives them an easy way to implement traceability, auditability, accountability and transparency.  In addition the service is often coupled, and used in conjunction with, other ADSP services. E.G an application is using the Notification Service it would use specific domain events to trigger notifications.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: Provides capabilities for uploading and managing files in Microsoft's Azure Blob Storage.  It includes support for virus scanning, access control, retention policy, retrieval, and searching. The service is intended to give applications a means to manage temporary files (e.g. retention policy < 30 days), or whose content is not directly needed by the application's business users.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: Provides the capability for creating customized PDF documents for downloading by end users. By utilizing our editor to create templates and combining them with intake data, developers can easily create GOA branded PDFs.  The documents are uploaded to Azure Blob storage and can be managed there securely, throughout their lifecycle, with the ADSP file service.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: Provides a push mode gateway  to events emitted in the event service, so clients can receive information without the need for polling.  Use it to monitor event streams, such as submissions received or payments made, to create a responsive, real-time web application.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: A service for monitoring the health of applications and other services.  You provide a URL for it to ping and it will notify you, or a webhook, if the response occurs in a timely manner or not.  Additionally, the service provides links to a static web page your users can visit to check on your application's status.  You can configure this page to display status updates and notices for planned maintenance or other outages.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: Enable text or email notifications in your application through the ADSP Notification Service.  Build customizable templates and use these to send personalized messages to your users upon the occurrence of specific "domain events" in your application, such as receiving approval for a submission, or reminders to take some action.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: The Access Service is a deployment of Keycloak, which provides Realms to tenants and serves as the basis for user access management.  As a federated IDP, Keycloak provides user authentication and authorization services, helping you to your tenant secure.  On top of Keycloak, the Access Service provides the user roles necessary to use all other ADSP services.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: Provides a temporal-based data store that is useful for storing such things as event, change, and audit logs.  In addition, it can be used to aggregate KPI's over some time interval by including metrics along with each entry.  For example, it has been used to log events along with a count metric, and therefore can be used to show how many events are emitted per unit of time.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: Gives developers the ability to quickly implement algorithmic changes requested by clients, such as policy changes, without having to redeploy the application.  This is particularly useful for calculations that are changed frequently, or for multi-tenant applications that handle calculations on a per-tenant basis.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: Capture information from users securely, and keep them informed on the status of their submission without requiring them to log in to your application.  Data can be entered and modified over multiple sessions; users are sent a verification code each time they wish to revisit the submission.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: Allows child care operators to request access to services provided by Children's Services. Requests are approved by authorized GOA staff.
AccessMethodDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment
Comments:
Used within Children's Services, but could be extended/reused by other business areas.
Requires the use of Keycloak.

Description: Allows GOA staff to manage the access of other GOA staff to the internal applications developed by Children's Services.
AccessMethodDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment
Comments:
Used within Children's Services, but could be extended/reused by other business areas.
Requires the use of Keycloak.

Description: An internal API that allows applications developed by Children's Services to get information about users, roles, and groups from the CCDS Keycloak realm.
AccessMethodDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment
Comments:
Used within Children's Services, but could be extended/reused by other business areas.
Requires the use of Keycloak.

Description: An Angular library that provides UI components and shared code for Angular apps in Children's Services, including authentication and authorization through the CCDS Keycloak realm.
AccessMethodDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment
Comments: Used within Children's Services to provide consistent UI and tooling for all Angular projects.

Description: A React library that provides UI components and shared code for React apps in Children's Services, including authentication and authorization through the CCDS Keycloak realm.
AccessMethodDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment
Comments: Used within Children's Services to provide consistent UI and tooling for all React projects.

Description: A web component library that provides UI components for use by the applications developed by Children's Services.
AccessMethodDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment
Comments: Used within Children's Services to provide consistent UI and tooling for all Vue projects.

Description: An internal API that provides information on all licensed child care providers in Alberta, as well as the staff (Early Childhood Educators) that work there.
AccessMethodDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment
Comments: Used within Children's service to provide data on licensed child care providers.

Description: Contains people records (users, learners, schools staff) accessed by Advanced Education.
Comments: Legacy shared service that may not always be suitable for digitally redesigned services.

Description: Contains programs, providers, specializations, session and cost information of the various private and public school mostly within Alberta.
Comments: Legacy shared service that may not always be suitable for digitally redesigned services.

Description: Provides a code which can be used to verify email address and SMS messaging.
Comments: Legacy shared service that may not always be suitable for digitally redesigned services.

Description: Gateway for sending text messages.
Comments: Legacy shared service that may not always be suitable for digitally redesigned services.

Description: Interfaces to Alberta Education to retrieve transcript information.
Comments: Legacy shared service that may not always be suitable for digitally redesigned services.

Description: Wrapper over Alberta Notify service and is intended to provide fault tolerance & guaranteed delivery
AccessMethodDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment
Comments: Emerging Service integration API may be more suitable. This service is a wrapper around ABNotify

Description: Provides functionality associated to attaching comments to an object for storage and retrieval.
AccessMethodDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment

Description: An API proxy that consumes Government of Canada employment API endpoints and handles security and API aggregation.
AccessMethodDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment

Description: Process of batching and sending SIN and tombstone profile information to federal government for match and validation purposes
Prerequisites: Utilization for Federal SIN Service requires business coordination and agreements to be put in place. This service is a bit coupled with Student Finance System but is used by Apprenticeship and Student Aid (potentially Foundational Learning will be added in the future)
Comments: Legacy shared service that may not always be suitable for digitally redesigned services.

Description: Interfaces between 1GX and GoA business applications.
AccessMethodDetails: Advanced request required through BERNIE; select the BERNIE service called '1GX Requests for Service Managers' under Service Catalogue, and then select '1GX API Service'.
Comments: Requests for this service will only be accepted by your ministry's 1GX Service Manager through a BERNIE RITM.

Description: Provides a number of document manipulation features including:  Mail Merges, PDF Form Filling and PDF Redaction.  This service supports a number of input and output formats (.docx, .xlsx, pdf, etc.)  -->  Enhancement requests can be made for additional features
AccessMethodDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; access the 'Service Integration Intake Request' web form

Description: Provides protection, monitoring and performance metrics for APIs.  The gateway can act as a firewall, router & DDOS protection for APIs and supports advanced features like "custom claims".  The gateway service is available for both internal/external and on-prem/cloud APIs.  This service leverages the Digital Identiity Gateway for API authentication.
AccessMethodDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; access the 'Service Integration Intake Request' web form

Description: Allows basic file management of project-specific content within ECM systems (e.g., file creation, modification, metadata, etc.) for OpenText.
AccessMethodDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; access the 'Service Integration Intake Request' web form

Description: Allows basic file management of project-specific content within ECM systems (e.g., file creation, modification, metadata, etc.).
AccessMethodDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; access the 'Service Integration Intake Request' web form

Description: Allows the user to access the platform to create and send envelopes, monitor and administer user activity and manage other aspects of the e-signature business process and workflow.

Sends emails to one or many recipients with multiple parameters: To, CC and BCC, ability to specify a FROM recipient, supply a subject line, options for the message body such as HTML, Rich Text or Plain Text, and the sender can attach one or more attachments to the  email.  Provides similar formatting capabilities as your outlook client.
AccessMethodDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; access the 'Service Integration Intake Request' web form

Description: A common e-payment service that offers a centralized electronic payment experience.   This service leverage the GoA TD Beanstream platform.
AccessMethodDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; access the 'Service Integration Intake Request' web form
Prerequisites: Business area will require a merchant account for their transactions.  This can be obtained through TBF merchant services (the process to obtain a merchant account is documented as part of the onboarding procedures)

Description: Provides confirmation of the authenticity of digital and printed documents claimed as issued under the authority of GoA - Government of Alberta. allows the user to create digital signatures in a form of QR (Quick Response) Code images which can then be verified by using this application or the third party solutions, like mobile or desktop custom applications.
AccessMethodDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; access the 'Service Integration Intake Request' web form

Description: This is an event management and correlation services that provides a holistic view of a service though dashboards, reports and alerts.  Splunk's primary monitoring capability is log/event based.
AccessMethodDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; access the 'Service Integration Intake Request' web form

Description: This enterprise monitoring service has a wide degree of monitoring and alerting options that can be setup for your needs.  This is the primary monitoring platform used within GoA.
AccessMethodDetails: This service can be requested through the BERNIE Portal

Description: The Service Integration team is responsible for creating and maintaining Enterprise APIs.  If there is a service you think would benefit the enterprise, contact the team and they might be able to create the capability you require.
AccessMethodDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; access the 'Service Integration Intake Request' web form

Description: DayJS plugin with information about stat holidays in Alberta
Comments: Instructions and additional information at: https://github.com/GovAlta-EMU/ab-holiday

Description: Keycloak client for Angular.
Comments: Instructions and additional information at: https://github.com/GovAlta-EMU/keycloak-auth-service

Description: Common UI components
Comments: Inspiration could be taken for the design library, not for use and being internally deprecated inside SCSS

Description: Provides a message bus interface to AB Notify
Module to define release announcements and survey prompts for users and track their responses (Dismissed, Postponed, Acknowledged)
Comments: This is a shared code module which teams deploy independently.  Work is planned to make a microservice deployment.  Actual survey results are stored in external system (ms forms), this only tracks if the user opened the survey.

Description: Verify service provides time limited random codes that can be used for validation purposes. For example, generated codes can be sent to a user by email and requested from an application to verify user access to the email inbox.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: The Design System team is responsible for creating and maintaining the assets used for building DDD product layouts, interactions, and patterns. The design system is a shared language for designers and developers to create consistent and cohesive user experiences across multiple products and platforms.
Version: Web components 1.14.0 / Design tokens 1.1.1 / Angular components 2.5.0 / React components 4.14.0
UseCases: A design system is a centralized resource that provides guidelines, assets, and code to help teams build digital products. It helps maintain consistency across multiple projects and allows teams to focus on higher-level tasks rather than reinventing low-level elements.
Comments: Include the design system in all DDD products; it should act as the foundation for developing the front-end of any government service.

Description: Pattern to integrate authentication with Alberta.ca MADI-B and GoA Azure AD though DIG. Keycloak delegates authentication to external IdP but handles user authorization and generate access_token
Pattern to implement OAuth BFF Proxy flow described here
Prerequisites: The implementation is using BFF Duende framework, license might be required

Description: All Justice Digital services are using a highly available cloud-hosted instance under a single Justice Digital realm. This will help reduce disruptions in access to Justice Digital services and enable external users such as lawyers to use multiple Justice Digital services with a single account, making access more streamlined.

Cloud native is the software approach of building, deploying, and managing modern applications in cloud computing environments. Modern companies want to build highly scalable, flexible, and resilient applications that they can update quickly to meet customer demands.

Justice Digital teams are using Amazon QuickSight as a data visualization tool. With QuickSight, all product teams can meet varying analytic needs from the same source of truth through interactive dashboards, paginated reports, and embedded analytics. 

Product teams are also fully automating their Data Pipelines using the a shared architecture pattern.
TD Bambora is the recommended payment solution for service teams within Justice Digital.

This is QA automation process outlined for service teams. Developers and QA testers should be able to use this as a guide to get started with QA automation within your application.

This documentation will go over all of the QA automation test frameworks in detail, outline the technology stacks used in this process

The Data Governance Plan outlines the processes and procedures to ensure data quality, security, and privacy across all shared services of the Justice Digital Services Platform. It comprises a set of standard operating procedures (SOPs) aimed at promoting consistency, reliability, and compliance in the handling, management, and modification of shared services.

Maintaining high-quality services requires a robust application support model to ensure both operational issues are dealt with; as well as to ensure an open line for direct customer feedback. As our services evolve and our user base continues to expand, an integrated support model will allow JD to continue to improve its service delivery capabilities.

Document Upload and Download
Justice Digital services use consistent architecture to facilitate document uploads and downloads.

PDF Generation & Merging
Justice Digital services use consistent architecture to facilitate PDF generation and merging functionality.

Justice Digital services utilizing the stamping shared services benefit from a consistent application of official court stamps, indicating filing and certification of documents in the digital context.

The court personnel API allows Justice Digital service/teams to look up metadata, contact information regarding Justices, Judges, Judicial Assistants, Application Judges and their court locations at any point in the service.

Metadata and contact information for Judges, Justices, Judicial assistants, and Application Judges are collected and updated in a single place.

Signatures of Justices and Clerks are managed within the Shared Service and through secure access, can be applied to documents as required.

 The shared service serves as the source of truth for this information, where delegated authorities from the courts update information for all other services and systems to pull from.
An IAM platform that provides federated sign on and identity verification for citizens accessing on-line services
An IAM platform that provides federated sign on for businesses and their staff accessing on-line services.

An IAM platform that will be used to unify Alberta.ca Account, MADI-B, and PED, as well as other IAM systems in the GoA over time.

Will enable multiple types of users under one common IAM solution, including citizen, external businesses and organizations and their staff, and internal GoA staff
A common cloud-based portal which enables business programs from Ministries and Platforms branch to quickly spin up customized payment portals suporting emergency or payment initiatives
A common cloud-based API services which enable payment portals with making payments and reconciling payments end-to-end. Payment types are being considered are eTransfer and EFT in bulk.
Allow applications to validate the financial institution number, branch number, as well as the format of the banking account number.

Assess the eligibility of an Albertan to apply for a Government of Alberta program that necessitates verification of the applicant's personal income and/or family income under a specific threshold. The use of data for this assessment requires a MOU with CRA and the Department of Treasury Board and Finance, as well as a privacy assessment.

Assess the eligibility of an Albertan to apply for a Government of Alberta program that necessitates verification of the applicant's child care benefits. The use of data for this assessment requires a MOU with CRA and the Department of Treasury Board and Finance, as well as a privacy assessment.

Verify new borns and deceased individuals against the data in Alberta Vital Statistics for a specific Government of Alberta program. This program requires approval from Vital Statistics for data usage, as well as  a privacy assessment.
